Reviews/Synopsis
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please go to the following website for detailed information:


Also known as The Magic Beggar, I've had this Mainland Chinese film custom subbed about the founder of Yang-style Tai Chi, Yang Luchan.

After the success of Shaolin Temple, hundreds of martial arts movies were produced in Mainland China. The Godly Beggar is among the best of them. I'd been interested in this film ever since reading the MAGTHKF review many years ago and now others can finally watch an English-friendly version as well.

Godly Beggar stars one of the most talented mainland martial artists, Wang Qun, who's best known in the West for Fist from Shaolin. (Trivia: He also had a bit role in Project A.) Wang Qun was always a skilled on-screen fighter, but here he shows off his acting chops as well, effortlessly portraying Yang's obsessive and borderline psychotic desire to learn Tai Chi. Wang Qun died at the fairly young age of 48, and this was his most memorable performance.

MAGTHKF Review:

Quote:
Stars: Wang Qun. MA rating: 5

"Epic mid-1980s mainland Chinese production (China Film Inc.), fictionalized legend of Yang style tai chi founder Yang Luchan, and his attempts to learn tai chi from Chen Chan Hsing (of the original Chen style. (Yang modified the Chen style to incorporate more sweeping motions). The second half features more drama than action. Nevertheless, this is a serious tai chi student's dream, and is full of well-choreographed tai chi training, performed by Wang and a high caliber mainland Chinese cast (many players from the Beijing Wu Shu Academy). Very obscure and probably hard to find."

-magthkf.ronlim.com

Enjoy the custom subbed Mainland martial arts film. By the way, I would be remiss without mentioning that this film stars another mainland martial arts mammoth, Yu Chenghui, of Yellow River Fighter and Heroes Returning to the East fame. He only has a small role, but he makes sure his presence is known, leaving behind a trail of carnage.
